text.p: Following are some of the leading stories in Russian newspapers this morning. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
KOMMERSANT DAILY
- Alexander Pochinok, the new head of the State Tax service who was appointed on Wednesday by President Boris Yeltsin, promises to be extremely tough.
- The upper house of Russia's parliament freed Yeltsin's hands when it delayed a vote on the fate of the art Moscow seized from Nazi Germany during World War Two.
- Russians will be able to see the work of the parliament only through the eyes of the deputies because all television cameras have been banned from the hall.
- Fifty-one percent of shares in Russian oil company "Sibneft" will be traded on a commercial base.
- Russian parliament passed a decision on Wednesday to revoke banks' licences before declaring them bankrupt.
- Three Belarussian banks will be the first non-residents allowed to trade on the Moscow Interbank Currency Exchange.
SEVODNYA

- The promotion of Mikhail Fradkov to the post of Foreign Trade Minister sounds natural (he has been deputy minister for two years), while Alexander Pochinok's appointment to head the State Tax service is very unexpected. He seems to be too emotional amd messy for this post, says he paper.

- German media highly assess President Yeltsin's success in changing the presidential election race radically last year, says the paper, in connection with the "Man of the Year" award to be granted to Yeltsin on Thursday in Baden-Baden.

- Only 40 percent of Moscovites are paying their rent regularly now and the figure is likely to fall with the completion of housing reforms in the capital. The reforms forsee the increase of payments for all municipal services.
NEZAVISIMAYA GAZETA

- The intention of an American non-governmental nuclear watchdog to give financial support to any anti-nuclear actions in Russia coincides with the successeful expansion of Russia's atomic technologies.
- The upper house of Russia's parliament did not risk decidibng the fate of the art which Moscow seized from Nazi Germany during World War Two and delayed a vote on this issue.
- Russian Defence Minister Igor Rodionov has expressed open support for the Chinese authorities in their row with the West over human rights in exchange for China's strategic backing for Moscow.
- Gennady Zyuganov is likely to be reelected the leader of the Russia's Communist party at its 5th congress scheduled for the week end.
SOVIETSKAYA ROSSIYA
- American and NATO agents in Russia's leadership are helping the West to occupy our territory, economy and culture, says Gennady Zyuganov.
- While the president is calling on people to buy homemade products, the government has raised the price of vodka, which has always been considered in Russia as a means of payment.
MOSKOVSKY KOMSOMOLETS
- Boris Yeltsin seems to be ready to discuss delicate problems with German Chancellor Helmut Kohl partner but is not likely to make any concessions.
- The Commonwealth of Independent States intelligence services are to set up a joint database on organised crime, drugs, arms and nuclear smuggling to unite their efforts in fighting these crimes.
- Tatyana Ustinova, Moscow newsroom, + 7095 941 8520.
